story.text: CHICAGO, Jan 3 Trading volume at the Chicago Mercantile Exchange increased 39.8 percent in December 2006 to 112,796,254 contracts, from 80,704,594 in December 2005, the CME said in their monthly volume report. The year-to-date volume through December 2006 was 1,403,265,003 contracts, compared with 1,090,351,711 contracts for the same period in 2005, an increase of 28.7 percent. Open interest at the end of December 2006 was 79,237,139 contracts, compared with 69,394,803 contracts in December 2005. story.title: cme dec volume up 39 . 8 percent to 112 , 796 , 254 contracts
